@d0<color=#00ffff>Research points:</color> <color=#ffffff>{Eden_UCHResearch}</color>\n<color=#00ffff>Description:</color> The Progenitor Translation Matrix grants access to Progenitor computer terminals. Required to access the core system controls on Progenitor Cores and other Progenitor computer systems.\n<color=#00ffff>Cost:</color> <color=#ffffff>{Eden_UCHResearchCost}</color> research points.
Create a Progenitor Translation Matrix for <color=#00ff00>{Eden_UCHResearchCost}</color> research points.

@d0<color=#00ffff>Research points:</color> <color=#ffffff>{Eden_UCHResearch}</color>\n<color=#00ffff>Description:</color> Decode the Encrypted Schematic to obtain a random schematic by using a schematic computer on board a UCH Research Vessel or your science station.\n<color=#00ffff>Cost:</color> <color=#ffffff>50</color> research points.
Create an Encrypted Schematic for <color=#00ff00>50</color> research points.

@d0<color=#00ffff>Research points:</color> <color=#ffffff>{Eden_UCHResearch}</color>\n<color=#00ffff>Description:</color> A data pad containing navigational data on the Andromeda galaxy. Allows you to plot safer and more efficient warp jumps. Increases the maximum range you can warp while piloting any ship. Turn in to Research Computers on UCH Research Vessels to increase the base range you can plot a warp jump. Increases base warp range by 1 light year.\n<color=#00ffff>Cost:</color> <color=#ffffff>50</color> research points.
Create Navigational Data for <color=#00ff00>50</color> research points.
@d0Gerald was here.\nThere appears to be an access card contained within this data pad.
Hello and welcome to the ship! It sure is a beautiful day here in {Player.PlayfieldName} wouldn't you say?\nKeep your eyes out for anything suspicious. We've had some weird things happening lately.
Wait, there's no day or night in space.
I suppose you could say it's always day, unless you're in deep space where there's not much light then it's eternal night.
Okay... I want to talk about something else. Anything else.
You're weird and I'm leaving now.

Supplies going missing. Reports of strange noises in maintenance shafts. A locked cargo box nobody seems to have the access card to.\nI am starting to think we have a stowaway. If you find anything of interest please bring it to me.
I will keep an eye out.

Ah hah! I knew it! We do have a stowaway!
From your description of the room you found it seems they are long gone now, though I wonder how this Gerald kept hidden from us.
From what little I can make out from this log, Gerald has been going from research vessel to research vessel.
Perhaps if you visit any other research vessels you should search them for anything suspicious as well.
If you find enough logs we may be able to reconstruct it.
I want to ask something else.
I want to talk about something else.

Here we go. I've reconstructed a small part of the log. Seems it contained the access code to the cargo container we've been trying to open. How lucky!
There, I've copied the access code to a new key card that should open the container, but I don't know where it's been moved to.

Should be somewhere on the ship. You can keep whatever weird stuff you find inside.
Thank you. I will look for it.
@d0The cargo container is locked.\nConnect to a cargo container before opening it.
@d0As soon as you insert the key card into the locking mechanism on the cargo container, the display starts flashing with red warning lights.

@d0It seems Gerald never finished wiring the explosive device up to the timer. At least this time his incompetence saved your life, for once.\nAh well, you may as well take his loot while you're here.\nMake sure you're connected to a cargo container first.
Leave, just in case it still explodes.
@d0Hello, I can explain to you what teleporters do and how to make use of them.
What restrictions are there on using teleporters?
How do I craft a teleporter?
Don't they use a lot of power?
I don't have any questions. Goodbye.

@d0It's simple! Just walk to the <color=#00ff00>teleporter</color>, interact with it, select a valid destination, and press the <color=#00ff00>Teleport</color> button and you'll be beamed off to your destination!\nTeleporters on <color=#ffff00>capital vessels</color> can only teleport within a sector <color=#ffffff>(Planet>Orbit, Planet>Moon, etc)</color>, while teleporters on <color=#ff0000>bases</color> can teleport much further.\nCheck the tooltips on the teleporter block for details.

@d0You can only teleport TO a structure that is owned by <color=#00ff00>you</color> or a <color=#00ffff>friendly NPC faction</color>.\nYou also cannot teleport FROM a structure that has been <color=#ff8000>recently attacked</color>  or that has an <color=#ff8000>active shield</color>.\nThere is also no guarantee that the teleporter on the other end will be active, so you should only teleport to destinations you know are powered and safe.

@d0First you must unlock the respective teleporter in the <color=#00ff00>Tech Tree</color> then craft it in an <color=#00ff00>advanced constructor</color>.\n<color=#ff0000>Bases</color> and <color=#ffff00>Capital Vessels</color> require different teleporters.
Welcome. I am the lead researcher here. How may I assist you?
<color=#00ff00>I have survey reports to turn in.</color>

Ah, thank you for completing those surveys. They have been in the backlog for awhile now.\nHere, I have some supplies that may be useful.\nMake sure you connect to a container via logistics before turning in the reports, wouldn't want your new supplies to go scattering across the lab!
<color=#00ff00>Turn in Alpha, Beta, Delta, and Epsilon surveys.</color>
I want to ask something else.
I have some questions about your mission here.
<color=#00ff00>Do you have any exploration rumors for me?</color>

Sure, there are a few exploration rumors you could follow up on.
These are not missions, so they won't be tracked in your <color=#00ff00>PDA</color>. Instead they are sightings made by members of our team or rumors from outside sources.
You simply have to find what it is and go from there.
Here's a list. Any of these sound interesting?
I want to ask something else.

We've discovered a mysterious object in the Rogue System. We do not know much about it except that it's of Progenitor origin.\nYou could go there and investigate it. You can find it by searching the galaxy map for Object 82 or for Rogue System.

Several of our teams have reported finding strange statues of Tal'on origin on some temperate planets.\nThey report they are well hidden and only show up on the detector within 3000 meters. Perhaps you can investigate them if you happen to come across any in your travels.\nThey are most likely only found where you would normally find Tal'on settlements, so don't go looking in the middle of Zirax territory or anything like that.

We've found secure data caches believed to be of Progenitor origin in orbits and exploration sites in cold systems such as around M, D, or N class stars.
The data caches are impervious to all of our weapons so don't even bother trying to brute force your way in.
You will need to interface with their computer systems and hack them in order to gain any of the Progenitor data locked within.
The Research Computer here on this ship can accept the data you find from these caches.
I want to talk about something else.
I don't have any more questions. Goodbye.

We are researching the remnants of an advanced civilization that lived here thousands of years ago. We call them the Progenitors, but they go by many names depending on who you ask.\nBy recovering enough information from the network of data caches, relays, and mainframes left behind by the Progenitors, we can create a translation matrix that allows access to their computer systems.\nIt's our hope that this will lead to scientific breakthroughs allowing us to find a new home for Humanity.
Hello and welcome to our ship!\nWe are currently studying the nearby gas giant of Alpha I.\nShe's a beauty, isn't she?

If there are any new missions you can help with, they will be listed below.\nMissions that you have already accepted can be found in your PDA under <color=#00ff00>Solo Missions</color> > <color=#00ff00>Project Eden Missions</color> > <color=#00ff00>UCH</color> and will not show up here.
I want to ask something else.

We've been so busy trying to set up these gas observatories that we haven't had a chance to complete our survey of the Alpha system.
Who knew that measuring hydrogen and water vapor levels required such sensitive and temperamental equipment?
If you were to complete the survey for us, I would be most appreciative.
I can download the details to your PDA for tracking.
I want to ask something else.

Welcome board. I am captain Terrie Elck.\nI hope you take a minute to admire the view from up here. We are studying the tidal forces between these two stars.\nFascinating stuff, though I'm afraid most of it is way over my head.

If there are any new missions you can help with, they will be listed below.\nMissions that you have already accepted can be found in your PDA under <color=#00ff00>Solo Missions</color> > <color=#00ff00>Project Eden Missions</color> > <color=#00ff00>UCH</color> and will not show up here.
I want to ask something else.

We've been lagging behind schedule for days now. Trying to adjust our sensors to account for the gravimetric shear between these two stars has taken up far too much of our time. We haven't had a chance to complete our survey of the rest of this system yet.\nIf you were to complete the survey for us, I would be most appreciative.\nI can download the details to your PDA for tracking.
I want to ask something else.

Ah, you've returned from your survey of the Alpha system. Are you ready to submit your findings?\nWe have some supplies you can have. Probably best if you <color=#ffff00>connect to a cargo container via logistics</color> before you turn the survey in.\nI will also give you a copy of the report you can hang on to until you've surveyed all 4 nearby systems. Don't lose it, I won't be able to replace it for you.
Not yet. I want to ask something else.

Ah, you've returned from your survey of the Beta system. Are you ready to submit your findings?\nWe have some supplies you can have. Probably best if you <color=#ffff00>connect to a cargo container via logistics</color> before you turn the survey in.\nI will also give you a copy of the report you can hang on to until you've surveyed all 4 nearby systems. Don't lose it, I won't be able to replace it for you.
Not yet. I want to ask something else.
Welcome to the UCHN Odyssey, and our fantastic view of the Delta star!\nWe are making short range scans of the star's surface features.\nAnything I can do for you?

If there are any new missions you can help with, they will be listed below.\nMissions that you have already accepted can be found in your PDA under <color=#00ff00>Solo Missions</color> > <color=#00ff00>Project Eden Missions</color> > <color=#00ff00>UCH</color> and will not show up here.
I want to ask something else.

We are still studying the local star so we haven't had a chance to survey the rest of the system yet.\nIf you are able to complete a survey for us I would be most thankful.\nI can download the details to your PDA for tracking.
I want to ask something else.

Ah, you've returned from your survey of the Delta system. Are you ready to submit your findings?\nWe have some supplies you can have. Probably best if you <color=#ffff00>connect to a cargo container via logistics</color> before you turn the survey in.\nI will also give you a copy of the report you can hang on to until you've surveyed all 4 nearby systems. Don't lose it, I won't be able to replace it for you.
Not yet. I want to ask something else.

If there are any new missions you can help with, they will be listed below.\nMissions that you have already accepted can be found in your PDA under <color=#00ff00>Solo Missions</color> > <color=#00ff00>Project Eden Missions</color> > <color=#00ff00>UCH</color> and will not show up here.
I want to ask something else.

We're still trying to recharge our power grid after the battle, so we haven't even begun our survey of this system yet.\nIf you could complete it for us I will make sure you get a reward from our supplies stash.\nI can download the details to your PDA for tracking.
I want to ask something else.

Ah, you've returned from your survey of the Epsilon system. Are you ready to submit your findings?\nWe have some supplies you can have. Probably best if you <color=#ffff00>connect to a cargo container via logistics</color> before you turn the survey in.\nI will also give you a copy of the report you can hang on to until you've surveyed all 4 nearby systems. Don't lose it, I won't be able to replace it for you.
Not yet. I want to ask something else.

We recently got out of a battle with a Zirax battlecarrier. We didn't take much damage but the fight drained our fuel reserves.
We're here trying to get back some power via an experimental solar panel setup, but so far haven't had much luck.
Plus being between a star and a gas giant seems like a pretty good hiding spot.
We might be short on supplies but I'm sure there's a few we could spare for you if you check in with the quartermaster.
Sure. Tell me all about hydroponics bays.
Sounds boring. I'll leave you to your plant stuff.

Hydroponics bays are advanced farming units that allow you to grow the equivalent of 9 crops in each bay.
The advantage is that it requires less manual effort to harvest because you only have to harvest once instead of 9 times for standalone crops.

They do not offer any yield or grow time benefit over planting 9 individual crops and they are more expensive to craft, so they are better for large scale farming operations where you might have to harvest dozens of bays.

@p9They are costly to unlock and require fertilizer which can only be purchased from traders, but the benefits are well worth it for the time you'll save during your harvests of large farms.

The size of your farm will determine if these bays are worth it for you.

@p9They will still require a grow light placed above them and a single hydroponics unit placed below them to function, and they do not protect your crops from any environmental hazards. If the crops inside die, you'll be left with an empty hydroponics bay and will have to craft a new one in an advanced constructor of the type of crop you want to plant.

Treat them just like you would any other crop.
Hello. How may I help you?
Yes. I heard about some mysterious objects found in space near the edges of the galaxy. Giant, ancient structures.
Do you know what their purpose might be?
Thank you for the information. Goodbye.
Heard they might be part of a larger puzzle, but no one has found a way in any of them.\nSome believe them to be built by a race called the Progenitors.
Heard House Rados found a large Pentaxid asteroid and built a mining station on it.

They said they contracted out to House Xenu to provide powerful defense satellites, but knowing the Xenu they keep control over the defense satellites from a remote location. Wish I could strike it rich by finding an asteroid of my own!
I'm sure you will one day. Goodbye.

Overheard some very loud pirates bragging a little too loudly about the next heist they were planning.\nSomething about raiding an abandoned tomb on a Desert Oasis class planet. Personally I think it's a bad idea, just because it's abandoned doesn't mean nothing lives there. Bad luck I tell you!
Surely you don't believe in curses?
I didn't survive this long by going into creepy places. No thank you!
You should try it sometime. Goodbye.
Some UCH scientist was telling me they are looking for Data Chips from Data Caches. Said he'd pay well for them too.
Yes. Ancient caches found in space in cold systems. Tougher than Xenosteel. You can't force your way in, you have to hack it.
I'll keep an eye out for them. Thank you.
Hi. May I help you with anything?

I was heading out to do some mining in a rogue asteroid field when I came across a damaged Zirax patrol vessel being torn apart by strange drones. Never seen anything like it! I turned straight around and came back here.
What do you think they are?
I don't know what they are. All I know is anything capable of taking out a Zirax patrol cruiser is something I want to stay far away from.
Sounds frightening. Glad you made it back safely. Goodbye.
Have you seen any... wait, I am supposed to be the one to ask you, not the other way around!
Well, have you? You tell me something, I will tell you something. Nothing is free around here.
I saw some strange stuff in space and stuff. Really strange stuff. In space.
I heard we might live in a virtual reality and our fate is not our own.
Okay! Okay! Fine I will tell you something. A friend was part of a salvage operation on a dead planet. She said they found an old emergency broadcast there. Wonder what else could be found?
That was not so hard, was it?
Overheard some Polaris corporate officers complaining about some settlers on Arid Mesa planets blocking their mining rights.
Let me stop you right there.
I overheard some Zirax captains talking about an ancient warp gate they had discovered.
Did they mention where this gate was?

Hmm... No, they didn't mention the exact location, only that it was somewhere near a place called Decay and that it was currently unpowered and they couldn't translate the alien language to activate it.
Thank you. Perhaps I will find this gate and succeed where they failed.
Hey. Do you have any astronomy books?

Ever since I was a child the stars fascinated me. I've been trying to get my hands on any books that I can to keep my mind engaged. Did you know that type M1Ia luminous red supergiants have an abundance of lava planets?
Fascinating. Thank you for that information. Good luck on your studies.
I'm sorry, I was only kidding! I'm interested in what you have to say.
Yeah, one of those who is too busy! Goodbye.
Before you go, I've been working on a small guide to star classes.\nWould you like a draft copy to read?
Sure I would love one! Hand it over!
A few of my friends have been searching for gravimetric sectors looking for ore. They said they can show up in space and what you find there can vary by the type of star!
Sounds like a good source of ore. Thank you.
Be careful where you warp to. I was drunk on Talon wine when I decided it was a good idea to warp into a sector with a high amount of radio chatter. Bad idea. Barely got out with half my ship left!
Sounds right up my alley. I've been looking for a good fight.
I'll make sure to avoid those sectors.
These aren't your typical bandit hideouts. They were more organized, and even called in reinforcements.\nI hope I don't find your ship in a scrapyard.
I'm not afraid of some puny bandits.
Hello stranger. How may I help thee?
Why are you talking like that?
One of my old friends has been making lots of money seeking out subspace signals in space. Best part he says is there's rarely any fighting involved.
Oh now you talk normal... Thanks for the information.
How DARE thou maketh funeth of thy speech! Curse you! Curse you to the Legacy!
I'm sorry! Has thou heard any news, fine sir?
You know what? Forget about it.
Welcome to the briefing room.\nI don't currently have any missions for you.

Hello. Are you interested in learning about hydroponics bays?\nNot to be confused with hydroponic units, which hold only a single crop at a time.\nI can tell you all about them! I just love plants and these bays make farming them a little easier.
@q0 @d0You can only see strings of unintelligible characters.\nYou cannot interface with the computer system of this ancient warp gate.
@q0 @d0You can only see strings of unintelligible characters.\nYou can use your translation matrix to interface with the computer system of this ancient warp gate.
@q0 @d0Activating translation matrix... Please stand by... @d3 @w2... @w2... @w2 ...\n@w4 @d0Translation matrix active.

@q0 @d0<color=#00ffc6>Warp gate status: Offline</color>\n<color=#00ffc6>Core power sources active in galaxy: {Eden_ProgCoreCount} of 9</color>\n<color=#00ffc6>Error: Insufficient power to operate. Warp gate cannot be brought online until all core power sources are active.</color>

@q0 Greetings commander.
I have been analyzing the data from the warp gate's memory banks and I believe I have found a clue where to find these power sources mentioned.
It appears there are subspace links between this gate and 9 locations along the outer rim of the Andromeda galaxy.
Perhaps you could begin your search there?

@q0 @d0<color=#00ffc6>Warp gate status: Online</color>
<color=#00ffc6>Core power sources active in galaxy: {Eden_ProgCoreCount} of 9</color>
<color=#00ffc6>Warp gate online and configured for personal travel. Enter portal to travel to destination.</color>
<color=#00ffc6>Warp gate not configured for transportation of ships.</color>
IDA, I'm stuck. What do I do here?

@q0 I can see that.
Well, if you already completed the mission here in Decay then you are free to do whatever you want, I suppose.
But if you did not receive the mission to explore Decay in your PDA then I can grant it to you now.
Of course, this won't work if you've already completed the mission or if it's already in your PDA. I hope you would know that, commander.
<color=#00ff00>Please upload the mission to my PDA.</color>

@q0 @d0<color=#00ffc6>Warp gate status: Offline</color>
<color=#00ffc6>Core power sources active in galaxy: {Eden_ProgCoreCount} of 9</color>
<color=#00ffc6>Power levels are sufficient to bring warp gate online.</color>
<color=#00ffc6>Begin activation sequence?</color>
@q0 @d0You can only see strings of unintelligible characters.\nYou cannot interface with the computer system of this installation.

@q0 @d0<color=#00ffc6>Core status: Active</color>
<color=#00ffc6>Cores active in galaxy: {Eden_ProgCoreCount}</color><color=#00ffc6>
Power level: 100%</color>
<color=#00ffc6>Subspace link destination: Andromeda-Decay Warp Gate</color>
<color=#00ffc6>Subspace link coordinates: 680,120,-20</color>
@q0 @d0You can only see strings of unintelligible characters.\nYou cannot interface with the computer system of this installation.\nThis core appears to already be activated.

@q0 @d0<color=#ffff00>WARNING: Activation of core will burn out your translation matrix. You will be unable to use it to activate additional cores and will have to create another.</color>\nA burned out translation matrix can still be used for later missions but will not activate cores.
@q0 @d0You can only see strings of unintelligible characters.\nYou cannot interface with the computer system of this installation using a depleted translation matrix.
Welcome to our town. How can I be of service?
Why did you colonize this planet?

We chose {Player.PlayfieldName} because it's so desolate. Some of the Terrans and aliens you see here were fed up with war or politics. Others have a past they'd rather leave behind. We keep to ourselves and life is simple here. That is, until that warlord showed up.
Warlord? Why would a warlord come to a planet like {Player.PlayfieldName}?
Why does any warlord do anything? Power. During our trades with the local Talon we heard rumors of an ancient relic they had discovered and kept secret. Perhaps this warlord is after the same thing?
I want to ask something else.

As a matter of fact, I do. We've lived on this planet without much incident but recently a Zirax warlord moved in, attacking a Talon village and building a fortress. I'm worried he will turn his eyes on us soon.
Sounds easy. I've destroyed plenty of Zirax fortresses.

You haven't taken on one like this before. It's made out of some kind of special alloy. Completely impenetrable to normal weapons. But there is a way in. They set up a teleporter in the village they destroyed. It's encrypted but I have a plan to activate it.
How do I activate the teleporter?

When we first colonized the planet we set up an array of com relays along the mountain ranges. It's possible they picked up some of the Zirax transmissions. If you were to obtain some of the communication logs from the relays, I might be able to decipher the password used on the teleporter. 3 communications logs should be enough.
I will bring you 3 communications logs.
I want to ask something else.
I want to ask something else.
I want to ask something else.

Yes, there is enough data here to decrypt the password for the teleporter... @w4There we go. Here is an access key that you can use to power up the teleporter. You can find the Ruined Village on the planet. Good luck.
I want to ask something else.

I'm terribly sorry but it appears your PDA is bugged and I cannot complete this mission for you.\nI've already given you the reward for turning in this mission, so you can go ahead and deactivate this mission and ignore it. It won't interfere with any of your other missions or cause you any problems in the future.\nYou can blame our PDA engineer Ravien for that.
Well okay then I will blame him!
I want to ask something else.
You cannot harm me through my shield, so don't even try.
I have come to end your reign!
End it? Hahahahaha. My reign has just begun! You cannot even imagine the powers that will soon be at my command! You will die, just like those insects did in the village.
Why did you attack that village? They posed you no threat!
They had something that I needed. Something... Valuable.
What could be so valuable here on this desolate rock?

I discovered part of a key. And I discovered it held a great power known as VOID. The little Talon were sitting right on top of it! They never knew what power laid just beneath their feet. Power of teleportation! With this artifact, I can teleport soldiers to anywhere! Including this room...
I will stop you now, no matter how many soldiers you send! <color=#ff0000>(Begin fight)</color>
I am done talking to you.
I am done talking to you.
I am done talking to you.
I will leave you be... For now.
Oh, you're still alive. Go, take your reward and leave me be. The door on the other side of the room should open momentarily. But know this, they are coming for you. They are coming for us all.
I will leave you here in defeat.
You should focus on defending yourself, not on talking to me.

@d0If you have any <color=#00ff00>encrypted schematics</color> in your personal inventory you may use this console to decrypt them and obtain a random schematic.\nYou can find encrypted schematics sometimes as rare loot.
@d0<color=#00ff00>You have obtained a random schematic in your personal inventory or connected container.</color>
@d0This computer console contains several log entries.

@d0<color=#00ffff>Log #13:</color>\n<color=#ff0000>We won the war. At least that's what they tell us. Does anyone truly win nuclear war?\nOxygen is running low so the rest of the survivors went into cryosleep while I stayed awake to keep an eye on things. A transport should be coming to pick us up in a few days and take us to the Ark.</color>
@d0<color=#00ffff>Log #14:</color>\n<color=#ff0000>It's been a week and no transport has shown up. When I asked how long it will be I was told another 24 hours.</color>
@d0<color=#00ffff>Log #15:</color>\n<color=#ff0000>It's been 3 weeks. A few days ago I stopped receiving any signals from the Ark or from UCH Command. I fear the worst.</color>

@d0<color=#00ffff>Log #16:</color>\n<color=#ff0000>I made the decision to brave the radiation and venture outside. It's been 3 months and there is no more food here. Perhaps I can scavenge for something in the nearby ruins.</color>

@d0Tactical Report: Ripper Dog and Drone patrols active. Makeshift Outposts under construction near areas of strategic importance. All drone carriers have crash landed on the planet or nearby moons. Remaining convoy ships in orbit heavily damaged and in need of repair. Emergency signal unable to send.

@d0<color=#00ffff>Geographical Report:</color>
Designation: {Player.PlayfieldName}.<color=#00ffff></color>
Rough terrain with steep cliffs and mountainsides. Iron ore detected along some canyon walls.
Low temperatures, high ambient radiation, and hotspots of geological activity detected.
Scans detect several small cave systems, possible hiding areas of escaped prisoners.

@d0<color=#00ff00>Biological Report:</color>
Several life forms have been detected living on the surface or underground.
<color=#ff00ff>Cave Worms:</color> <color=#ff0000>Hostile</color>. Potential source of food. Detected on most areas of the planet's surface.
<color=#ff00ff>Wood Walkers:</color> <color=#ff0000>Hostile</color>. Potential source of wood and plant fiber. Found in some areas, most often during night.
<color=#ff00ff>Dead Wood:</color> <color=#00ff00>Not hostile</color>, we hope. Potential source of wood and plant fibers. Detected on top of mountains.

@d0Damage Report:\nShip heavily damaged. Main engineering section missing. Emergency transmitters destroyed. Exterior weapons systems offline. Interior weapons systems online.\nWARNING: Prison cell security compromised!
My... My name is Commander Johnson. Maria Johnson. I was stationed on a UCHN Frigate when we were attacked by Zirax.
Before they attacked they hailed us and told us if we surrendered 5 of our crew, they'd let the rest go. Mentioned something about a bounty from House Abyssal.

After I was captured, one of the Zirax officers took me down here where an Abyssal scientist performed experiments on me.\nThey kept injecting me with something they called Infection Strain 127-B. Then they'd draw my blood. Over and over again.
Don't worry, we'll get out of here.

No no no, it's too late for me! I'm too sick and trapped in a stasis field. You'll never get these doors open in time. Go and save yourself. The rest of the Humans in Andromeda must hear what happened here. They must be warned, the Abyssal are after us!
Wait, before you go I have something that will help you. In the crash the Abyssal scientist dropped his Blue KeyCard over there. Make sure you take it. Maybe it can be of use to you.
I will make sure they pay.
@d0<color=#ff0000>Medical lock down on crew quarters in effect.</color>
<color=#00ff00>Lift medical lock down on crew quarters.</color>
@d0<color=#00ff00>Medical lock down lifted. Crew quarters are now accessible.</color>
You are an enemy of our people and I will not speak with you! Now begone from our sacred temple!

Welcome to our temple, traveler. Please help us! Filthy Zirax pirates have raided our sacred tomb and our ancient relics are in danger! If you were to retrieve the Relic of the Sun, we would be in your debt.
Thank you for your help recovering our sacred relic from our tomb.

The tomb is where we buried many of our most holy artifacts, but it fell into disarray long ago. Both clans had placed their most holy relics inside the tomb for safekeeping, but with the Zirax pirates trying to get in they are no longer safe. The tomb is guarded by many traps and creatures, and will take cunning and skill to make it out alive.
What is the significance of these relics?

They have been passed down by our ancestors ever since we first settled on this world. Every year, we bring them out of the tomb to recharge our temples on the holy day of Osarius before returning them to their resting place. But with the Zirax at the tomb, we have been unable to retrieve our relics!
I was not aware Tal'on possessed advanced technology.

Long ago, our ancestors came to this world fleeing a great war. They built these temples. While their secrets have become lost to the sands of time, we still honor their great migration and keep the temples powered.

You've found it! You've found the Relic of the Sun! Thank you. Now our temple's power will be restored. As a token of our gratitude, I shall give you a fragment of our holy relic. Hold on to it, you might find use for it.
Never mind. I'm going to keep it for now.
You are an enemy of our people and I will not speak with you! Now begone from our sacred temple!
Thank you for your help recovering our sacred relic from our tomb.
What is the significance of these relics?
I was not aware Tal'on possessed advanced technology.

Welcome to our temple, traveler. Please help us! Filthy Zirax pirates have raided our sacred tomb and our ancient relics are in danger! If you were to retrieve the Relic of the Moon, we would be in your debt.

The tomb is where we buried many of our most holy artifacts, but it fell into disarray long ago. Both clans had placed their most holy relics inside the tomb for safekeeping, but with the Zirax pirates trying to get in they are no longer safe. The tomb is guarded by many traps and creatures, and will take cunning and skill to make it out alive.

They have been passed down by our ancestors ever since we first settled on this world. Every year, we bring them out of the tomb to recharge our temples on the holy day of Osarius before returning them to their resting place. But with the Zirax at the tomb, we have been unable to retrieve our relics!

Long ago, our ancestors came to this world fleeing a great war. They built these temples. While their secrets have become lost to the sands of time, we still honor their great migration and keep the temples powered.

You've found it! You've found the Relic of the Moon! Thank you. Now our temple's power will be restored. As a token of our gratitude, I shall give you a fragment of our holy relic. Hold on to it, you might find use for it.
Never mind. I'm going to keep it for now.

<color=#00ff00>Authenticating user...</color> @w2<color=#00ff00>User {PlayerName} recognized.</color>\n@w4<color=#00ff00>Full systems access granted.</color>\n@w4<color=#00ff00>Welcome back, sir. Would you like to view your last log entry?</color>
Yes please. Show me my log.
Not right now, I don't need another reminder of what happened. In fact delete it.
@q0 @d0You can only see strings of unintelligible characters.\nYou cannot interface with the computer system of this ancient warp gate.
@q0 @d0Activating translation matrix... Please stand by... @d3 @w2... @w2... @w2 ...\n@w4 @d0Translation matrix active.

@d0A barely functioning escape pod. It is impossible to tell what is inside without opening it.\nMake sure you are connected to a container via logistics in case the contents are too large to fit in your personal inventory.
@q0 @d0<color=#00ffff>Current Lock Code:</color> {Eden_Password}\nEnter new lock code. Set to <color=#00ff00>0000</color> for public access.
@q0 @d0You have entered an invalid lock code. The lock code must be a positive number.

@d0This wreck is on the verge of a critical failure at any moment.\nYou may be able to stabilize the systems by hacking into this diagnostic computer.\nIf you fail the hack, or if you get too close the wreck may explode.
@d0The core of the beacon has been destroyed. There is nothing that can be done with it now.

@d0This beacon is damaged and in need of repair before it can be fully activated. Once active you can use it to contact the owners of the beacon.\nBringing it fully online will require {Eden_RepairItemCount} {Loc(Eden_RepairItemType)}.
@d0The beacon has been activated and is now transmitting at full power and ready for 2-way communication.
Thank you for contacting the Polaris MegaCorp customer support center.\nI am representative number {Random(500,20000)}, how may I assist you today?
<color=#00ff00>I am sending you the coordinates to one of your distress beacons.</color>

Polaris MegaCorp thanks you for your assistance.
We will dispatch a salvage and recovery specialist to recover whatever wreckage remains.
I have been authorized to transfer 10000 credits to your account.
Was there anything else I can assist you with today?
<color=#646464>You do not have the required materials to repair this beacon.</color>

@q0Commander, IDA here.
I have scanned the beacon and noticed something odd.
It appears someone has tampered with the beacon and changed its transmission frequency to one frequently used by bandits and raiders.
If you activate this beacon there's a chance whoever tampered with it will come back, thinking you easy prey.
I would only activate it if you are ready for a fight.
<color=#ff0000>I look forward to a fight. Activate the beacon.</color>
Best to leave it alone then.
@q0Well well well, look what we have here. Some little explorer activated my beacon.\nGet 'em, boys!
You have reached the local Trade Federation Logistics Support Hotline.\nPlease state the reason for your call.
<color=#00ff00>I found one of your distress beacons. I am sending you the coordinates to it now.</color>
This is a Free Colonist secure channel. How did you get this frequency?
<color=#00ff00>I found an emergency beacon belonging to someone in the Free Colonists.</color>

Received, thank you.
Ah yes, we did have a few shipments go missing around that sector. I will make sure that the wreckage is towed back and the families of those lost are contacted.
The Trade Federation owes you a debt, and to pay it I transferred 15000 credits into your account.
Have a nice day and thank you for choosing the Trade Federation.

Ah thank you. That must be the crew that went missing some time ago.\nHere, it's not much but I sent you 10000 credits. Please let us know if you find any more emergency beacons belonging to a member of the Free Colonists.
I will keep an eye out. Goodbye.
@q0NO. Don't make me tell you again!
Gerald, I can see you through the viewscreen you know.
@q0What? I thought I turned that off! Ugh, no matter. There's nothing you can say to get yourself out of this one, Spanj.
<color=#ff0000>I am sad it has to be this way, Gerald, but you leave me no choice.</color>

@q0Commander, I am unable to fix the tampering on the beacon.\nI recommend you deactivate it to prevent anyone else from falling victim to this trap.\nI also found something that may be of value that was in the wreckage of one of the bandit ships.
@d0The logs have been downloaded to your PDA.
@d0The logs have been downloaded to your PDA.
@d0The logs have been downloaded to your PDA.
@d0The logs have been downloaded to your PDA.
@d0The logs have been downloaded to your PDA.
@d0The logs have been downloaded to your PDA.
@d0You have already opened this escape pod.
@d0The escape pod was empty. Either there was never anyone inside, or they were rescued and the pod sealed back up for some reason.
@d0The occupant of the escape pod was alive!\nThey've been placed in your connected container.
@d0The occupant sadly passed away but they left behind some personal belongings.\nPerhaps you could take them to a GIN console to get them delivered to their next of kin.
@d0Sadly the occupant did not survive but they left some supplies you may as well take.
@d0Sadly the occupant did not survive. On them you find a data pad with an unfulfilled contract.\nPerhaps you can honor them by fulfilling the contract.

@d0<color=#ff8000>Welcome to the Diagnostic and Repair Console 6000.</color>\n<color=#ff0000>WARNING:</color> <color=#ff8000>Storage tank integrity breached. Catastrophic failure imminent.</color>\n<color=#ff8000>Recommend stabilization protocols be enacted immediately.</color>
@d0<color=#ff8000>The Diagnostic and Repair Console 6000 system is currently not available.</color>
What is the Diagnostic and Repair Console 6000?

@d0<color=#ff8000>The Diagnostic and Repair Console 6000 (or DRC6k) is a complete and almost totally automated repair system that can be fitted to anything from a small drone to large space stations and capital vessels.\nFrom fuel leaks and air supply issues to warp core breaches and damaged thrusters, the DRC6k is capable of carrying out almost 2000 types of common repairs. The DRC6k is the leading repair system in the galaxy, trusted by over 400 corporations and factions.</color>

<color=#ff8000>Interpreting data... </color><color=#00ff00>Done.</color>
<color=#ff8000>Analyzing damage... </color><color=#00ff00>Done.</color>
<color=#ff8000>Extrapolating optimum repair procedure... </color><color=#00ff00>Done.</color>
<color=#ff8000>Configuring on board systems for repair procedures... </color><color=#00ff00>Done.</color>
<color=#ff8000>Bringing repair systems online... </color><color=#00ff00>Done.</color>
<color=#ff8000>Initiating stabilization protocols... </color><color=#00ff00>Done.</color>
@d0<color=#ff8000>The requested repairs have been completed.\nThe area is now safe to approach. Have a nice day.</color>
The ritual is complete. Hand over the Corrupted Shard of the Stars and I will give you a cleansed version.
Hand over the Corrupted Shard of the Stars.
I want to ask something else.
This shard is just one part of three. Find the other two, and you may be able to combine them.
I want to ask something else.
The ritual will be done in a moment. Talk to me again when the light fades.

You carry a relic of our past on you, traveler. I can perform a ritual of cleansing on your Corrupted Shard of the Stars, drawing out the corrupted energies contained within and allowing you to unlock its true potential. It will take only a minute to perform.
I want to talk about something else.
Please wait a minute. Speak to me again once the lights have faded and I shall give you your cleansed relic back.
Thank you. I shall wait for you to finish.
Greetings, traveler. Have you come to contemplate the universe?

Magic? Hahah. No, kind traveler. It is merely knowledge, lost to the ages. I come from an ancient people who traveled the stars long before your kind even knew what the stars were.\nAnd fought in a war, more terrible than you could imagine.

That, too, has been lost with time. We fled our homeworld to escape the great war and split into 4 clans. The Sun Clan, the Moon Clan, the Star Clan, and The Enlightened. I myself am of the Star Clan. We have had contact with the Sun and Moon clans but haven't been able to find anyone from The Enlightened. My people still wander the galaxy searching for them.

Nobody knows. They built shrines such as these in places of spiritual importance, but they haven't been seen or heard from in many of your Terran years.\nSome believe they went in search of 3 ancient relics of our people, but were never seen agian.
Nobody knows exactly what they are for, but I believe that by finding all 3 relics they can be combined into a single one that will show the way to finding our lost people.
I will see what I can do. Thank you for your time, wise Talon. I hope you find the rest of your people.
Ah yes we did find something interesting. So very interesting! UCH Command thanks you for your service, Captain Rick!
Oh yes of course, Captain Rick {PlayerName}. How could I forget you.
For the last time... MY NAME IS NOT RICK!
It's... Never mind. What did you find in the data?
How DARE you speak to a commanding officer with that tone! Apologize immediately or I shall have you reprimanded, captain!
I apologize, sir. What did you find in the data?
I am Grand Admiral {PlayerName}, leader of the Terran Navy in Andromeda. I will forgive your disobedience for now...
Thank you, Grand Admiral {PlayerName}. Funny, we have the same last name.

We found something important hidden in the data you sent to us. It appears that The Creators were trying to build something you Terrans call a Dyson Sphere. We need you to find out if they were successful.
Why did you call them The Creators? Why are you talking like that?
I'm familiar with a Dyson Sphere. Something that large should be easy enough to find.

A Dyson Sphere is a large superstructure built around a star. In theory, such a structure would allow nearly unlimited energy to the civilization that constructed it. Such an undertaking would likely take thousands, if not millions of years. We need you to find out if they had built such a structure and if it's possible to get inside.
Why did you call them The Creators? Why are you talking like that?
Something that large should be easy enough to find.
What do you mean? I am talking like a perfectly normal Terrrrrran of average age and health. There is nothing suspicious about my speech. You are being a Kripthar!
I'm familiar with a Dyson Sphere. Something that large should be easy enough to find.
It's like a Charrloop, but frecklier.
Excellent! Now in order to-\n@d0(The signal is suddenly interrupted by another transmission)
Hello? Can you hear-zrrrkk-me? This is UCH Command. Do you hav-crrrkkkwpp-data? Were you succes-zzzhhchc
Wait... Who was I just talking to?
@d0<color=#00ffc6>◓  ◑  ◓  ◐  ●  ◎  ◓</color>\n<color=#00ffc6>You have not proven yourself, little one.</color>
@d0<color=#00ffc6>You... What have you done? Do you not know what doom awaits you?</color>
I demand that you activate the portals right now!
I don't have time for your nonsense! I demand that you activate the portals right now!
That doesn't answer my question. Will you please activate the portals?
Well, that tells me a lot... Not.

@d0<color=#00ffc6>I have spent a million years watching over this sphere. I have kept it safe from our children's children, and you safe from it.</color>\n@p9 @d0<color=#00ffc6>I have tried to warn you, tried to stop you, and you have recklessly pursued your own destruction. So be it.</color>
I'm not afraid of you. Activate these portals right now!
I have done as you asked, but it will come with a price in time.
I will pay it when the time comes.
@d0<color=#ff8000>This digit of the code is </color><color=#ff0000>lower</color><color=#ff8000> than your guess.</color>
@d0<color=#ff8000>This digit of the code is </color><color=#ffff00>higher</color><color=#ff8000> than your guess.</color>
@d0<color=#ff00ff>This console has been reset for debugging.</color>

@q0Greetings, commander.
I have analyzed the data structure of this computer system so that I can give you a brief rundown.
This system is simple enough that even you should be able to hack it.
@p9 @q0It is protected by a code that is split up into {Eden_CodeLength} separate digits.
Each digit of the code can range between a value of 0 and 9 and you will need to guess each digit individually.
After each guess I will be able to tell you whether the code is higher or lower than your guess.
You will have limited attempts before being locked out of the system, so choose the numbers you guess wisely.
Thank you IDA, that was extremely helpful.
Are you here from maintenance to finally fix my light? It's driving my guests away and giving me a headache!
Ummm... What? I mean, yes, I'm here to fix your light.

Finally! About time one of you showed up. The maintenance hatch is in the bar behind me. Go inside and get my light fixed! And don't touch anything you're not supposed to. Last tech who went in there blew out half the casino's security system!
Right away sir! Wait, I seem to have forgotten my maintenance access code. What is it again?
Consider it done. That troublesome light won't be bothering you anymore.
What do you mean, you forgot your access code? The code is 8544, but don't tell anyone I told you or I could get called up to the manager's office on the top floor. Just get that light fixed!
What's taking you so long? The light still isn't fixed! In fact I think it's gotten worse!\nWhat are they paying you people for? Get into that maintenance tunnel behind my bar and get to work!
I umm, seem to have forgotten my access code.
I forgot my access code. Again.
I will get right on it!
Again? I already told you what it was! You incompetent buffoon!\nYour code is 8544, go get my light fixed or I'll serve your head as our lunch special!
You are an enemy of my people and I will not speak with you.
Thank you for your help recovering the eggs from my prized crawler!
Please traveler, you have to help me!

The last batch of eggs from my prized Crawler were stolen in the night! I would be forever in your debt if you were to return them to me unharmed.\nPlease, recover them. They are special to me.\nYou may be able to find them in the forests nearby.
I will recover these special eggs for you.
No thanks. Get your own eggs back, you lazy bum! <color=#ff0000>(-10 reputation)</color>

Thank you, traveler. Exactly 5 eggs were stolen, please return once you have found all 5.\n\n@d0His eggs have most likely already been eaten, but perhaps you can obtain eggs from the local raptors or Triceratops and he won't know the difference.
I will return with your precious eggs.
You found them! My prized Crawler eggs! Larry, Harry, Barry...
<color=#00ff00>Here are your eggs. Where's my reward?</color>
I am not ready to hand them over yet.
@d0This mission has already been activated. There is nothing of further value to be found here.

Heading unknown.</color>\n@p9 @d0<color=#00ff00>Scan complete. This matches the frequency you are looking for.</color>
@d0Subspace Antenna online.\n<color=#ff0000>ERROR:</color> <color=#ffff00>Subspace frequency not selected.</color>\nSelect a frequency to perform a scan.
@d0You do not know how to operate this terminal.\n\nYou must be on the mission The Dead Chapter 2 to access this terminal.
@d0This technology is ancient, perhaps thousands of years old. Some instructions are left behind that your computer can translate.
Activating the neural interface...\n@p6Interface activated. You may enter when ready.
You're awake. @w3 Good.\n@w3We were worried the procedure didn't work. I'm glad to see you pulled through, Korvas. There's a lot to do and not a lot of time to do it.

You don't remember? Not entirely unexpected.\nYou volunteered for an important mission to keep the memory of our species alive. We implanted a chip in you to record your memories of this event, so maybe one day someone in the future can see that we existed and we didn't go without a fight. This memory chip is currently active and streaming your memories to the vault, but the central database is not yet active.
What's going on? Who are we fighting?

What, not who. A force more powerful than anything we've ever faced before. We've seen them destroy countless worlds beyond our own, but now they are on our doorstep.\n@p9 @d3We don't know where they came from. Everything we throw at them just bounces off their hull. They seem to have only one weak point, the glowing energy spheres that are on the outside of their structures. Even then, destroying those merely slows them down.

We don't. There's no way out of this for any of us. Our only hope is that future civilizations learn from our mistakes. Do not release it. Don't let it out! Don't try to use it. If you find it, keep it frozen, buried forever beneath the ice and forget you ever saw it.
We are almost out of time. Report to the captain just outside the front door! Make sure your armor is in good shape, soldier!

You there! You're one of the ones with the neural implant, aren't you?
I have a great idea... How about you show those in the future how we blow stuff up! Our artillery bunker to the north was overrun by the enemy. Go there and clear it out of hostiles. You'll also need to grab some of the artillery shells from the cargo boxes outside of the artillery bunker and load up the ammo controller inside.
@p9 @d3When you've secured the artillery station, man the gun and destroy one of the green spheres below the enemy's command spheres!
Make sure to aim carefully, as you'll only get a couple of shots before needing to reload.

Yo-@w2 You haa-aa-@w2 ave to get out of here! @w2 Go! @w2 Run!\n\n@d0The soldier is clearly shaken by whatever he experienced. You need to find a way to bring him out of it if you're going to get a useful report.
Tell me what happened or I'll drag you off!
We can still beat this! We have a plan but we're counting on your report.
@d0The soldier begins to cry. What you said clearly upset him. Try again.
Tell me what happened or I'll drag you off!
We can still beat this! We have a plan but we're counting on your report.
@d0The soldier, still visibly shaking, points towards the east and hands you a data pad with his orders without making eye contact.

@d0<color=#00ffc6>===============================================================</color>
<color=#00ffc6>The western power station is destroyed.</color>
<color=#00ffc6>Divert power to the Ark from the eastern power station.</color>
<color=#00ffc6>Complete this mission at any cost.</color>
<color=#00ffc6>===============================================================</color>
The facility does not have enough power to charge the shield! Head to the Eastern Outpost and divert power!
Prepare yourself. The enemy is upon us! You must hold off the enemy long enough for the Ark's shield to become fully charged. For our people!
I need more time to prepare.
